verses.verse: Then I <S%H7725>returned<s%> and <S%H7200>saw<s%> all the <S%H6217>oppressions<s%> that are <S%H6213>done<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun:<s%> and <S%H1832>behold,<s%> the tears of those who were <S%H6231>oppressed,<s%> and they had no <S%H5162>comforter;<s%> and on the <S%H3027>side<s%> of their <S%H6231>oppressors<s%> there was <S%H3581>power;<s%> but they had no <S%H5162>comforter.<s%>
Therefore I <S%H7623>praised<s%> the <S%H4191>dead<s%> who have <S%H3528>been<s%> long <S%H4191>dead<s%> more than the <S%H2416>living<s%> who are <S%H5728>yet<s%> <S%H2416>alive.<s%>

<S%H2896>Yes,<s%> better than them <S%H8147>both<s%> is him who has not <S%H5728>yet<s%> <S%H7200>been,<s%> who has not seen the <S%H7451>evil<s%> <S%H4639>work<s%> that is <S%H6213>done<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun.<s%>

Then I <S%H7200>saw<s%> all the <S%H5999>labor<s%> <S%H3788>and<s%> <S%H4639>achievement<s%> that is the <S%H7068>envy<s%> of a <S%H376>man<s%>'s <S%H7453>neighbor.<s%> This also is <S%H1892>vanity<s%> and a <S%H7469>striving<s%> after <S%H7307>wind.<s%>
<S%H2896>Better<s%> is a <S%H3709>handful,<s%> with <S%H5183>quietness,<s%> than <S%H2651>two<s%> <S%H4393>handfuls<s%> with <S%H5999>labor<s%> and <S%H7469>chasing<s%> after <S%H7307>wind.<s%>

There <S%H3426>is<s%> <S%H259>one<s%> who is <S%H8145>alone,<s%> and he has neither <S%H1121>son<s%> nor <S%H251>brother.<s%> There is no <S%H7093>end<s%> to all of his <S%H5999>labor,<s%> neither are his <S%H5869>eyes<s%> <S%H7646>satisfied<s%> with <S%H6239>wealth.<s%> "For whom <S%H6001>then,<s%> do I labor, and <S%H2637>deprive<s%> my <S%H5315>soul<s%> of <S%H2896>enjoyment?<s%>" This also is <S%H1892>vanity.<s%> <S%H7451>Yes,<s%> it is a miserable <S%H6045>business.<s%>
<S%H8147>Two<s%> are <S%H2896>better<s%> than <S%H259>one,<s%> because they <S%H3426>have<s%> a <S%H2896>good<s%> <S%H7939>reward<s%> for their <S%H5999>labor.<s%>

For if they <S%H5307>fall,<s%> the <S%H259>one<s%> will lift <S%H6965>up<s%> his <S%H2270>fellow;<s%> but <S%H337>woe<s%> to him who is <S%H259>alone<s%> when he <S%H5307>falls,<s%> and <S%H8145>doesn't<s%> have another to lift him <S%H6965>up.<s%>
<S%H1571>Again,<s%> if <S%H8147>two<s%> lie <S%H7901>together,<s%> then they have <S%H2552>warmth;<s%> but how can <S%H259>one<s%> keep warm <S%H3179>alone?<s%>

If a <S%H259>man<s%> <S%H8630>prevails<s%> against one who is <S%H8147>alone,<s%> two shall <S%H5975>withstand<s%> <S%H8027>him;<s%> and a threefold <S%H2339>cord<s%> is not <S%H4120>quickly<s%> <S%H5423>broken.<s%>

<S%H2896>Better<s%> is a <S%H4542>poor<s%> and <S%H2450>wise<s%> <S%H3206>youth<s%> than an <S%H2205>old<s%> and <S%H3684>foolish<s%> <S%H4428>king<s%> who <S%H3045>doesn't<s%> know how to receive admonition any <S%H2094>more.<s%>
For out of <S%H631>prison<s%> he <S%H3318>came<s%> forth to be <S%H4427>king;<s%> <S%H4438>yes,<s%> even in his kingdom he was <S%H3205>born<s%> <S%H7326>poor.<s%>
I <S%H7200>saw<s%> all the <S%H2416>living<s%> who <S%H1980>walk<s%> under the <S%H8121>sun,<s%> that they were with the <S%H3206>youth,<s%> the <S%H8145>other,<s%> who succeeded <S%H5975>him.<s%>

There was no <S%H7093>end<s%> of all the <S%H5971>people,<s%> even of all them over whom he <S%H6440>was<s%>â€”yet those who come <S%H314>after<s%> shall not <S%H8055>rejoice<s%> in <S%H1892>him.<s%> Surely this also is vanity and a <S%H7475>chasing<s%> after <S%H7307>wind.<s%>
